string-array.name: level_stories
string-array.item: school_friend

school_friend@R:So, finally you'll get graduated tomorrow!
 school_friend@R:Are you stressed by the final examination?
 hero@L:Well, not really.
 hero@L:I don't expect the examination to be that hard. This invoker school is not famous for its difficulty.
 school_friend@R:Sure, that's why I selected that one!
 school_friend@R:But still, what about a small training fight?
 hero@L:I don't really need to, you know?
 school_friend@R:Oh, come on! I'll start gently with a small card.
 school_friend@R:And I'm really curious to see what kind of creatures you can invoke now.
 hero@L:If you insist…

school_friend@R:Well, I knew you would have defeated that one easily.
 hero@L:Is that all you can do?
 school_friend@R:Don't worry, the next one will be stronger!
 school_friend@R:If I were you I would get some new cards at the school library.
 school_friend@R:I heard that the owner was once a great invoker but now he is starting to get too old for that and trade his invoker cards in exchange of some well-executed tasks.
 school_friend@R:That's a easy way to become a better invoker, but be careful: you can't take too many card in your deck unless you become more experienced and gain more free slots.
school_friend
school_friend@R:So, ready to fight?\n hero@L:I don\'t need to be ready to defeat you.

school_friend@R:Again, it seems to be so easy for you that it\'s almost frustrating…\n school_friend@R:But it\'s not finished yet, I still have something to try.\n school_friend@R:I have some support card to use after my creatures to reinforce them, so you would better prepare yourself.
school_friend
school_friend@R:Now I\'ll go full power! Prepare yourself!\n hero@L:How long will that last? I\'m not in the mood of playing.

school_friend@R:Well, I admit there is no use to continue, I guess you're ready for the examination.
 school_friend@R:More you level up and more you'll be able to easily invoke several powerful creatures, I have to admit I'm curious to see how far you'll end up in the army.
 school_friend@R:By the way, do you already knows what you want to do after your diploma?
 hero@L:Yes. However it is a bit complicated to explain.
 school_friend@R:Huh? OK, anyway the Erya Kingdom is recruiting almost everyone for his army, so I guess you won't have much choice actually.
school_master

school_master@R:Here is the final examination day!
 school_master@R:How do you feel?
 hero@L:As usual, ready.
 school_master@R:Great. You just have to win that battle and you'll be an official Erya Kingdom invoker!

school_master@R:Here you are! That wasn\'t hard for you, right?\n school_master@R:I\'m happy to say you\'re now an official invoker, you\'ll soon receive your diploma.\n school_master@R:Afterward you\'ll be interviewed by an Erya Kingdom officer. The kingdom is trying to reinforce his army and they integrate a lot of students.
officer

officer@R:So before we start let me present myself: I was also an invoker student and I\'m now lieutenant in the Erya army.\n officer@R:I\'m notably in charge of recruiting invokers from all over the kingdom and assign them to a specific regiment.\n officer@R:First of all, show me what you are capable of.
officer

officer@R:I have to say I'm impressed. You have your place in our great army.
 hero@L:I don't want to integrate the army.
 officer@R:Well, I'm afraid you cannot really refuse the proposition. The King orders are clears, we need to requisitioned all capable people.
 officer@R:If you refuse you risk to be judge for disloyalty.
 hero@L:Fine. But before bring me to the King's counselor. Even if I don't integrate the army, I can be very useful to the King.
 hero@L:I have some information that will interest the King, and I can do more than what you have seen for now.
 hero@L:Let me prove it to you right now with a second fight, but this time do not restrain yourself.

officer@R:I see… You\'re clearly above the level of a classic newly graduated invoker.\n hero@L:Now please bring me to the counselor. I have a proposal that he will like.\n officer@R:OK, let\'s go to the King\'s Castle. But don\'t be too optimistic, I\'ll closely watch you and there is big chances he will not accept to receive you.
counselor

officer@R:You're lucky, the counselor accepted to see you, but he wants to know your motivations.
 counselor@R:Exactly. Be strong is not a good enough reason to see the King, what do you want exactly?
 hero@L:I came from the forest village of Oras.
 hero@L:The life was peaceful there, however the river is almost dried now. So the forest is dying and the village with it.
 officer@R:Could it be…
 hero@L:Yes. It is due to the fact that the King had rerouted the river for the army needs.
 counselor@R:So you are here for revenge? The whole continent is in need of water and we unfortunately have to do some choices.
 hero@L:I know the situation. I also know that the recent tensions between us, the Myrth Kingdom and the Qahor Kingdom are due to the water.
 hero@L:But I have a solution and a deal.
 counselor@R:And what would that be?
 hero@L:I cannot speak here with so many people around. I request an interview with the King.
 counselor@R:Our majesty is well occupied, as you can imagined. I'm sorry but this is out of question.
 counselor@R:Guards, please escort this young women outside.
 hero@L:Wait!

counselor@R:Why are you opposing resistance? I could execute you for that, and what tells me that you do not want to harm our Majesty?\n hero@L:It is really important for me to see the King, and killing him will not save my village.\n counselor@R:Well… You\'ll first explain your plan to me in privacy. Then I may change my mind.
